content.text: How TO - Add Active Class to Current Element
Learn how to add an active class to the current element with JavaScript.
content.html: Learn how to add an active class to the current element with JavaScript.

content.code_html:
<div id="myDIV">
  <button class="btn">1</button>
  <button class="btn active">2</button>
  <button class="btn">3</button>
  <button class="btn">4</button>
  <button class="btn">5</button>
</div>

syntaxHighlighting.text:
/* Style the active class (and buttons on 
  mouse-over) */

syntax_highlighting.text:
/* Style the active class (and buttons on 
  mouse-over) */

content.code_html:
/* Style the buttons */
.btn {
  border: none;
  outline: none;
  padding: 10px 16px;
  background-color: #f1f1f1;
  cursor: pointer;
}

/* Style the active class (and buttons on mouse-over) */
.active, .btn:hover {
  background-color: #666;
  color: white;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
/* Style the active class (and buttons on 
  mouse-over) */

syntaxHighlighting.text: // Get all buttons with class="btn" inside the container

// Loop through 
  the buttons and add the active class to the current/clicked button

syntax_highlighting.text: // Get all buttons with class="btn" inside the container

// Loop through 
  the buttons and add the active class to the current/clicked button

content.code_html:
// Get the container element
var btnContainer = document.getElementById("myDIV");

// Get all buttons with class="btn" inside the container
var btns = btnContainer.getElementsByClassName("btn");

// Loop through the buttons and add the active class to the current/clicked button
for (var i = 0; i < btns.length; i++) {
  btns[i].addEventListener("click", function() {
    var current = document.getElementsByClassName("active");
    current[0].className = current[0].className.replace(" active", "");
    this.className += " active";
  });
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: // Get all buttons with class="btn" inside the container

// Loop through 
  the buttons and add the active class to the current/clicked button

content.text: If you do not have an active class set on the button element to start with, use the following code:
content.html: If you do not have an active class set on the button element to start with, use the following code:

syntaxHighlighting.text: // Get all buttons with class="btn" inside the container

// Loop through 
  the buttons and add the active class to the current/clicked button

// Add the active class to the current/clicked 
  button

syntax_highlighting.text: // Get all buttons with class="btn" inside the container

// Loop through 
  the buttons and add the active class to the current/clicked button

// Add the active class to the current/clicked 
  button

content.code_html:
// Get the container element
var btnContainer = document.getElementById("myDIV");

// Get all buttons with class="btn" inside the container
var btns = btnContainer.getElementsByClassName("btn");

// Loop through the buttons and add the active class to the current/clicked button
for (var i = 0; i < btns.length; i++) {
  btns[i].addEventListener("click", function() {
    var current = document.getElementsByClassName("active");

    // If there's no active class
    if (current.length > 0) {
      current[0].className = current[0].className.replace(" active", "");
    }

    // Add the active class to the current/clicked button
    this.className += " active";
  });
}
